title: Basic Tools
content: Students learn about common tools used at home and school, such as scissors, hammers, rulers, and pencils. They understand the proper use and safety rules for each tool.
takehome: 1. Identify tools at home. 2. Practice using a pencil and ruler safely. 3. Draw pictures of your favorite tools. 4. Explain what each tool is used for. 5. Discuss safety rules with your parents.
exercises: Circle unsafe ways to use tools.
Write the names of 5 tools in your home.
Practice measuring a pencil with a ruler.

title: Simple Machines
content: Children explore basic machines like levers, pulleys, and wheels. They learn how these machines help make work easier in everyday life.
takehome: 1. Observe simple machines at home. 2. Explain how a lever helps. 3. Draw a pulley lifting an object. 4. Discuss wheels you see on vehicles. 5. Talk about how machines make work easier.
exercises: Draw a lever and label it.
Circle examples of simple machines in pictures.
Explain how a wheel helps in movement.

title: Introduction to Electricity
content: Students learn about electricity as a source of power. They explore common electrical appliances and understand basic safety rules around electricity.
takehome: 1. Identify electrical appliances at home. 2. Never touch wires with wet hands. 3. Switch off appliances when not in use. 4. Discuss with parents the safe use of electricity. 5. Draw a light bulb and fan.
exercises: Write one rule for electrical safety.

title: Introduction to Computers
content: Children are introduced to computers, their parts, and basic functions. They learn about the keyboard, mouse, monitor, and CPU, and how computers are used for learning and play.
takehome: 1. Identify parts of a computer at home or school. 2. Practice using the mouse under supervision. 3. Draw a computer and label its parts. 4. Discuss uses of computers with parents. 5. Explain what a computer can do.
exercises: Label the parts of a computer.
Circle the input and output devices.
List two ways computers help us.
Practice typing letters on a keyboard.

title: Printing and Writing Tools
content: Students learn about printing and writing tools like pens, pencils, crayons, and printers. They understand how to use them properly to write, draw, and print simple documents.
takehome: 1. Practice writing letters and numbers neatly. 2. Draw and color a picture. 3. Observe a printer at school. 4. Discuss writing tools with parents. 5. Keep your writing tools organized.
exercises: Circle the tools used for drawing.

title: Shapes and Design
content: Children explore basic shapes like circle, square, triangle, and rectangle. They learn how to combine shapes to make simple designs and patterns.
takehome: 1. Identify shapes at home. 2. Draw 5 different shapes. 3. Create a simple pattern using shapes. 4. Discuss shapes found in objects. 5. Practice coloring inside shapes.
exercises: Circle all triangles in a picture.
Create a pattern using squares and triangles.

title: Materials Around Us
content: Students learn about common materials like wood, metal, plastic, and cloth. They discover the properties of each material and how they are used in daily life.
takehome: 1. Identify materials at home. 2. Draw an object made of wood and plastic. 3. Discuss which materials are safe to use. 4. Touch and feel different materials. 5. Talk about materials in your classroom.
exercises: Write one use for each material.
Observe and list 5 materials at home.

title: Energy and Power
content: Children learn about energy, sources of power, and how it is used. They explore sunlight, batteries, wind, and human effort as sources of energy.
takehome: 1. Observe how toys use batteries. 2. Talk about solar panels you see. 3. Try turning a fan using wind or hand. 4. Discuss energy-saving tips. 5. Draw examples of energy sources.

title: Transport and Vehicles
content: Students learn about different modes of transport, including bicycles, cars, buses, and boats. They understand how vehicles move and the importance of traffic safety.
takehome: 1. Observe vehicles on the road. 2. Draw your favorite vehicle. 3. Discuss how vehicles help us travel. 4. Talk about road safety rules. 5. Explain why bicycles need pedals.
exercises: List 3 vehicles you see every day.

title: Communication Tools
content: Children learn about basic communication tools such as telephones, letters, emails, and signals. They understand how people share information using these tools.
takehome: 1. Write a short letter to a friend. 2. Identify communication tools at home. 3. Discuss how email works with parents. 4. Draw a telephone and letter. 5. Talk about the importance of communication.
exercises: Match communication tools to their uses.
Draw a scene showing people communicating.
Write a message for a friend.
